intro: Adicea capitellata, commonly known as the small-headed adicea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in compact clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Adicea capitellata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
